intro: Hieracium chasmataeum, commonly known as the Chasmataeum hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils, often in mountainous regions, and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium chasmataeum is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
